Funding Source: CRRSAA
Description: Funds for emergency rental housing, including rent and utility assistance and case management
Detail Description: These funds support emergency rental housing. At least 90 percent of awarded funds must be used for direct financial assistance, including rent, rental arrears, utilities and home energy costs, utilities and home energy costs arrears, and other expenses related to housing. Remaining funds are available for housing stability services, including case management and other services intended to keep households stably housed.
source_name: U.S. Department of the Treasury Emergency Rental Assistance Program Payments/USA Spending

Funding Source: ARPA
Description: Assistance for households that are unable to pay rent or utilities
Detail Description: Provides funding to assist households that are unable to pay rent or utilities
source_name: U.S. Department of the Treasury Emergency Rental Assistance Program Payments/USA Spending

Funding Source: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
Description: Behavioral health services to support stable housing for high utilizers of emergency services
Detail Description: Provides behavioral health services to support stable housing for high utilizers of emergency services
source_name: City of Chicago ARPA Recovery Plan

Funding Source: CARES
Agency: U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development
Description: Homelessness assistance and prevention
Detail Description: These funds are designated to prevent, prepare for, and respond to the Covid-19 pandemic among individuals and families who are homeless or receiving homeless asssitance, and to support additional homelessness assistance and prevention activities
source_name: U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development CARES Act Emergency Solutions Grant (ESG) Appropriations

Funding Source: ARPA
Agency: U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development
Description: Supportive services, affordable housing, and homeless shelters
Detail Description: These funds can be used to finance supportive services and construct new affordable housing, and for the acquisition of non-congregate shelter spaces for people experiencing homelessness
source_name: U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development

Funding Source: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
Agency: Chicago Department of Family and Support Services
Description: Rehousing support for people experiencing homelessness to rapidly exit from homeless shelters or unsheltered locations and maintain stable housing
Detail Description: The Rapid Rehousing ARPA Initiative extends and builds on the Expedited Housing Initiative, a surge housing effort funded with $35M in CARES Act funding, which helped Chicagoans experiencing homelessness rapidly access housing and minimize the health risks of COVID-19. Continued investment in expanded rapid rehousing services for households experiencing homelessness in Chicago to rapidly exit from homeless shelters or unsheltered locations and maintain stable housing. Services include housing location, rental assistance, and case management services for up to 24 months.
source_name: City of Chicago

Funding Source: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
Description: Support for residents behind on mortgage payments
Detail Description: The Emergency Mortgage Assistance Program will provide funds to support residents who are behind on mortgage, insurance escrow, and residential real estate tax escrow payments. The program will also fund additional housing services supports to offset foreclosure and further increase household stability.
source_name: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

Funding Source: CRRSAA
Description: Funds for emergency rental housing, including rent and utility assistance and case management
Detail Description: These funds support emergency rental housing. At least 90 percent of awarded funds must be used for direct financial assistance, including rent, rental arrears, utilities and home energy costs, utilities and home energy costs arrears, and other expenses related to housing. Remaining funds are available for housing stability services, including case management and other services intended to keep households stably housed.
source_name: U.S. Department of the Treasury Emergency Rental Assistance Program Payments

Funding Source: ARPA
Description: Rental and utility assistance
Detail Description: These funds can be used for rental and utility assistance to states, territories, counties, and cities to help stabilize renters during the pandemic and help rental property owners continue to cover their costs
source_name: U.S. Department of the Treasury

Funding Source: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
Description: Rental and utility assistance, as well as housing services to offset evictions
Detail Description: The Emergency Rental Assistance Program will provide funds to support residents who are behind on rent, utilities, and household expenses and will cover forward rent to support renter household stability. The program will also fund additional housing services and supports to offset evictions and further increase household stability. Cook County will administer this program in partnership with the Housing Authority of Cook County.
source_name: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

Funding Source: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
Program: Fixed-Site Emergency Shelter for People Experiencing Homelessness
Description: Shelter services for people experiencing homelessness
Detail Description: The Bureau of Economic Development will support organizations within the Cook County Continuum of Care to stand up fixed-site shelter in 5-7 locations to provide health and safety to people in a housing crisis who cannot be diverted from homelessness. These organizations will also provide shelter services to ensure their experience of homelessness is short by reconnecting them to housing and other supports.
source_name: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

Funding Source: CARES
Agency: U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development
Description: Homelessness assistance and prevention
Detail Description: These funds are designated to prevent, prepare for, and respond to the Covid-19 pandemic among individuals and families who are homeless or receiving homeless asssitance, and to support additional homelessness assistance and prevention activities.

Program: Homelessness Assistance & Supportive Services (aka HOME-ARP program)
Agency: U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development

Detail Description: Funds to finance supportive services and construct new affordable housing, and for the acquisition of non-congregate shelter spaces for people experiencing homelessness
source_name: U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development

Funding Source: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
Agency: Cook County Bureau of Economic Development
Description: Hotel-based sheltering for people experiencing homelessness
Detail Description: The Bureau of Economic Development will continue the hotel-based sheltering approach implemented during the pandemic, when the existing PADS model of shelter with congregate shelter in rotating church basements was no longer viable
source_name: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

Funding Source: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
Program: Permanent supportive housing for people experiencing homelessness
Description: Creation of 250 permanent supportive housing units
Detail Description: Cook County will create 250 new units of permanent supportive housing, a nationally recognized best practice for ending homelessness. Permanent supportive housing is a housing model that pairs non-time-limited rental subsidies with individualized, intensive, supportive services to help households maintain independent living and housing stability.
source_name: Cook County ARPA Recovery Plan

Funding Source: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
Description: Creates new financing programs and tax incentives for affordable housing
Detail Description: Creates new financing programs and tax incentives to support the creation and preservation of affordable housing in communities across Illinois

Funding Source: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
Description: Programs supporting youth experiencing homelessness
Detail Description: The Homeless Youth program is a holistic model designed to increase the safety of youth ensuring that their basic survival needs are met while also providing safe and stable housing; education and employment services, and the life skills necessary to become self-sufficient. The primary service delivery approach includes assessment and individualized case management. Program goals include: Ensuring youth are safe and stable; increasing the number of self-sufficient youth among the homeless youth population; and fewer homeless youth. The program targets youth 14-23 years of age who lack safe and stable housing.
source_name: State of Illinois Executive Office of the Governor Governor's Office of Management and Budget

Description: Funding to help prevent mortgage delinquency, defaults, foreclosures, loss of utilities or home energy services, or homeowner displacement
Detail Description: Provides funding to help prevent mortgage delinquency, defaults, foreclosures, loss of utilities or home energy services, or the displacement of homeowners experiencing financial hardships
source_name: State of Illinois Executive Office of the Governor Governor's Office of Management and Budget

Funding Source: ARPA
Description: Funds to assist homeowners with delinquent mortgage payments
Detail Description: This program provides relief for vulnerable homeowners. The law prioritizes homeowners who have experienced the greatest hardships, leveraging local and national income indicators to maximize intended impact. Funds can be used to make delinquent mortgage payments. States must request funds and will receive funds based on their unemployment rate, number of mortgages in foreclosure, and number of mortgages that are past due.
source_name: U.S. Department of Treasury Homeowner Assistance Fund Allocations

Funding Source: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
Description: Increasing affordable and supportive housing supply
Detail Description: Increasing the supply of affordable housing and supportive housing and addressing homelessness to build stronger communities
